TL-aOREdfxvoO8OJnWTfUw.text: I have been to this Japanese for several times, I cant say it is the best in London, but it is definitely one of my favourite Japanese. Food are good!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat Tokyo - London, United Kingdom. Sashimi don

APaolodWbUnjWv6SquOpFg.text: Restaurant had above average Japanese food for London.  Waitress was attentive, but really busy.  Green tea was among best I have had anywhere in the world.For dinner, I had the foie gras daikon.  You already know that foie gras is fattened duck liver.  Daikon is a white Japanese radish.  I ate more fat in the foie gras than I had eaten in all the combined meals in the prior month.  I also the bento box with salmon and teriyaki chicken, which was tasty.  The chicken needed to be deboned a little better.  My meal with tip was around 30 pounds.

_PwjbVRxl55n_vv1NEaAoA.text: The prices in this spot are unbelievable. So if you are looking for reasonably-priced sushi, this is a great spot. However, we found the food hit and miss. Starter of edamame was overcooked and bland. Impressive because it's hard to mess up edamame. However, the salmon nigiri was sublime. Melt in your mouth. We also ordered two tuna hand rolls, which were serviceable. The two specialty rolls--crispy yellowtail and spicy tuna--were not to our liking. Regardless, we were filled and the tab was cheap. I think we may have chosen unwisely.

WxEJBdehy_8Gm54UO9MByQ.text: Looking for cheap sushi? Lots of options? This is your joint.I came here to meet my man during his lunch break as we were looking to satisfy our Japanese fix. The decor is very standard, basic, but clean. The menu is massive, so many options, which is wonderful. I am a sashimi lover and I was pleased to see all the choices. I opted for a seaweed and cucumber salad and the yellow tail sashimi. My salad was light and delicious. I was most surprised how tasty the sashimi was. My man opted for a sushi cut and hand roll, which supposedly was good as well.The only problem I had with Eat Tokyo was the slow service. It took our food forever to come out and they brought out my food first and then waited about 10 minutes to bring out my man's, which was a bit strange. Otherwise, tasty, good, and easy on the wallet. I'll be back.

Xio3Z2swtcnGq8PpRjqftQ.text: Hang on!  What is with all the rave reviews of this place?!?!  The sushi was not overly fresh, the tempura was super greasy, the wrong dishes came to our table, and the food was not consistent with other Eat Tokyos (the one I am referring to is the one on Red Lion street, which is super!).  In addition, the wait staff were not particularly responsive!   I unfortunately will not be returning.

7H4ceu3SSvYD8sNqfW9NKA.text: Lovely restaurant! It's quite casual and unpretentious but still I like it a lot there and what's even better  the staff are very friendly and welcoming. So far I've tried their sushi which was good, but quite ordinary, what I loved were the bentos. There wasn't a single thing in the set I didn't like. I feel bad giving it 4 stars but I would love to see them include a take out service, it's a shame that you can't enjoy their delicious food in the comfort of you home.

RTWYJGwY4dju2_8zIMJomA.text: Fairly traditional Japanese restaurant with an extensive menu, ranging from normal sashimi and Bento to more unusual dishes such as one with pan fried foie gras. For the price I don't think there is better Sushi/Sashimi in London. Hard to find cuts like Toro are nearly always available, and the portions are very generous. Maybe double the size of the same order at Nobu etc. Service is pretty good. Absolutely exceptional food though.

5ANzj4hEMcvpYDrZ6gX6Jw.text: This is a good sushi restaurant and definitely the real deal. However whereas this is good, their one in Golders Green is fabulous !

smRJCqYNTuYBzGQMQgQwAQ.text: I'm not so stellar at cooking so I'm a bit embarrassed to admit that my hubby and I visit Eat Tokyo at least twice a week.  The menu is huge, prices are reasonable and the service is good.  The restaurant itself is pretty small and not spectacularly decorated, but the food is fab.  Try the Hot Spicy Miso.  YUM!

fc1SisV5xfb-Xwdyu1-5fw.text: I've spent a lot of time in Notting Hill over the years and never noticed this little restaurant tucked away in a side street. But it goes straight onto my list of favourite places. If you're looking for glamour then you won't find it here. Instead, you'll find a simple, no-fuss place that serves delicious, great value Japanese food.

c_VIHr1jMCk9Hb_HoAWZTQ.text: My favourite Japanese take away in the area since I moved to the wonders of Notting Hill. Gotta try the Chicken Katsu and Salmon Teriyaki boxes: filling, tasty, inc. small soup & salad and all £5! Great lunch time spot. They also do sushis of course and have an inside siting area.

6UJYUEevQpG4JUgJj3lCWQ.text: Delicious, authentic and great value. Been looking for somewhere like this for a while and I'm glad I've finally found it! No more Itsu for me!

qM1O0xzBlcHG__cN5q-zLQ.text: I almost don't want to share this gem if a restaurant. It deserves a mention as it serves casual Japanese food that is of the quality of places like Nobu for half the price. We have been to all 3 of their restaurants on London and this on is up there at the top. The decor is low key but clean. It all about the food, excellent bentos great sushi and good price beer. Keep an eye on the waiting staff as they may need reminding of your waiting order though. Better than soho branch never too busy as it's only been open a month or so. Enjoy!

SJDNFL_fYhBlJci0PMnIdQ.text: Totally authentic with a full Japanese cuisine menu beyond sushi and sashimi. My husband had to stop me from dining here after 3x in one week! I usually order one of their bento boxes. The reason for the 4 stars is they are slow for dine-in service and non pre-ordered takeaways. This place is always busy but only has one or two wait staff.

WxffI-uEK6FFATmHMHOCUw.text: Great neighborhood sushi place. Extensive menu with a lot of variety for good prices. The rolls were prepared well with just the right amount of rice and the fish was very fresh.Service was efficient and friendly. They were very busy on a Tuesday evening but still managed to serve us in a timely manner.

RVj9GbIxzcyktPYDJCq4Mw.text: Really delicious and, most importantly when it comes to sushi, FRESH food. Staff are pleasant and quick. Not much elbow room, as they've shoved as many tables and chairs as possible into this small space, but somehow it doesn't bother me. One thing that does annoy me is they are quite strict when it comes to how long you can use the table for. They start to get finicky once you've gone over an hour. So this isn't the place for you if you want to have a nice long relaxing meal. My favourite dishes are the prawn tempura roll, seaweed + cucumber salad, harumaki (spring rolls), & the chicken katsu (better than any chicken nugget you've ever had in your life)! Enjoy!

wD9I1niZCUW_8IF_RxYNtA.text: Since I moved to London, I have been looking for a go-to sushi spot that isn't too pricey and has fresh, quality sushi with a menu that has both authentic rolls as well as some fusiony/inventive rolls. So far, Eat Tokyo is the best place to satisfy all of those wants. Eat Tokyo is a small restaurant situated just off the hustle and bustle of Notting Hill Gate. They have an extensive menu that should satisfy sushi and non-sushi eaters alike. The fish is fresh and the items are priced reasonably by London standards. Something that I also really enjoyed is this didn't seem like sushi place catering to Londoners in the city. I honestly feel like I'm back home in California when I come here, in a cozy sushi joint frequented mostly by regulars and locals. I think that's the best about it honestly.In addition to the food and the vibe, the service is very good. They are very attentive, but also not rushing out out of your seats (even though this place does get very busy during dinnertime). I would highly recommend if you're looking for some good fresh sushi that won't break the bank.

jTiQaZn1BCP88Ub_FtFOcA.text: We took a Teriyaki Salmon Bento Box for lunch. The portion has really nice size, definitely manly size. Price was very good as well - £5. But the waiting time (20min) and serving wasn't up to London Lunch Leage

rAEyMhRLev9za76HXyMeHA.text: Really liked the food here. Delicious and quite authentic. Most importantly, not too expensive. You can get the whole set with sashimi, tofu, rice, some tempura and others for even under £10! I would go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat Tokyo - London, United Kingdom. Delicious! @ Eat Tokyo

Ty2d4pRyamRpvpXGu9IN1A.text: Found this through Yelp -- thank you fellow Yelpers! We were craving a bit of sushi while cruising the Notting Hill neighborhood. The prices were surprisingly reasonable, and the sushi absolutely delicious. I would come here again. Fun-entertainment for the evening: I had two girls in deep "therapy" right next to me discussing their woeful love life. Although extremely amusing, and also pitifully sad, it didn't detour us from enjoying our food. In closing:Dear table sharing ladies boo-hooing next to us:The reason why you attract the wrong men is because you come off as desperate and shallow. Realize your self worth, you'd be surprised!PS. next time, don't air your dirty laundry so loudly. Then I'd keep my thoughts and comments to myself. :D

mZ4UXbP_MZ7ZvY0vmv2chA.text: I have mixed feelings on this place. Great prices and really tasty sushi...but I had terrible food poisoning when I returned to my flat.  If you watch the staff carefully thru the open kitchen while you wait for a table you will notice a woman using her bare hands while putting sushi onto the plates. I'm not sure if I got sick from their kitchen not following health and sanitation rules or if the sushi they serve wasn't fresh.

SKNJ9efzOm7uoW3ZLytbsg.text: Great little sushi spot. This is average sushi fare. Nothing to extra ordinary but a great place to grab a bite to eat. We came with a party of 6 and all enjoyed ourselves, however no one had a food orgasm or anything of that nature.The decor was very simple. This place appears to be run by authentic Japanese even though they feature many westernized rolls.

7tuLJtBp38BfkK_Kk9vMOw.text: Ooh, cheap and good Japanese restaurant!  I've been here a couple of times (admittedly both times after drinking, but that's beside the point).  Eat Tokyo is a fairly cosy and basic restaurant and, if you're in a large-ish group, you may get put in one of the karaoke rooms downstairs.  I didn't really recognise any of the artists that they were offering (Harry Love, anyone?), but it was immaterial as I was the only real keen karaoke-er there.  The menu is pretty big and can be daunting if you're not so familiar with Japanese food.  I've had the katsu curry here which was decent and generously sized; last time I tried some of their sushi - my assorted sashimi bowl had tuna, salmon, mackerel, octopus, and what I think was amberjack.  The fish was generally pretty tasty - a lot better than a lot of sushi places in the same price bracket.  The takoyaki (octopus balls) are also good here - plenty of delicious brown sauce dressing (I don't know the name, but it's incredible).Whilst not a world beater, Eat Tokyo's great, especially since it falls into the value range of Japanese restaurants.  So, next time you're in the area and heading to Wagamama...give Eat Tokyo a try instead.

Vhj7tbTEEPV-46g7gmIKIQ.text: I love this place. It has such a buzzing and fun atmosphere, any day of the week. I would advise booking in advance if possible to avoid having to wait, as it is very popular and books up very quickly. You can eat here cheaply or expensively, as its extensive menu allows a variety of choices that should fill you up very satisfyingly. I would highly recommend the Salmon Teriyaki Bento Box....£9, lots of options, and will 100% fill you up, more than you will most likely need. DELICIOUS. Dates are wonderful here as its buzzing atmosphere masks any potential awkward silences and it's relaxed vibe and quick service means that if it's going badly...you shouldn't have to endure it for too long...! And sharing starters such as Gyoza is always quite romantic ;-)

aKHn2QbMDhMt0ljAzrQRIg.text: So, here food very is good. Essential, fresh, true Japanese. We had an amazing sashimi boat (one of the first time I've tried a 100% sashimi one - most of the times it is a sushi mix) and several rolls which we could not get tired of. And the price, a pleasant surprise - great quality/price ratio.On the other hand, it is a very informal place - not fancy, neither romantic. Good for a casual dinner, or when you do not need to impress.

uiF2QC7wbyqI5FHKDeJflg.text: For London this is cheap and good sushi.  I wouldn't recommend the spicy rolls because I think they have cayenne pepper on the outside of the role which doesn't go that well but all of the other rolls were delicious! I had no idea this was located 2 minutes from my flat because it's hidden on a side street but definitely find it so you can enjoy the delicious sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat Tokyo - London, United Kingdom

NwVK_twbttam_G-KzXLhgQ.text: Some of the best sushi in London!! A must go! You know you have found a good japans place when it is filled with Japanese people!

SElI81dUOGk10-8fTziFig.text: Sushi buonissimo, e personale gentilissimo! Se capitate a Londra provatelo!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat Tokyo - London, United Kingdom. Il miglior sushi che abbia mangiato!

pbWH-zGFwm4BAUSO403_hA.text: Great quick and helpful service from start to finish. Got the teriyaki chicken bento, chicken was juicy and sweet. Great value for money and filling for Japanese. Authentic Tokyo vibe and decor, hassle free and informal eating. We tipped on top of the service charge as the staff all work hard and look tired.

yj1hndSftLWP9o3mpVQo4A.text: Stunning Japanese food at reasonable prices- I've finally found the real deal in west London! On the same street as the more famous "Feng Sushi" and very close to the new enormous "Itsu" in Notting Hill Gate- I've just eaten the best California Rolls I've had in London! I also had edamame and a wonderful spicy squid and a coke for just £10!The chef and staff are Japanese and they are clearly very proud of the food they serve and the way they serve it. The chef appears to have quite a history of awards and the fact everything is in Japanese with smaller English print (sometimes!) underneath speaks volumes about their target market- London's resident Japanese population (and anyone else with a sense of curiousity or adventure!). They also seem to do very reasonable take away lunches for about £4.50. Well worth a visit-I'll probably be back once a week at least!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat Tokyo - London, United Kingdom

7ERJkCxXSW_itxoyb16Qog.text: Good honest sushi restaurant on a quiet street near NottingHill gate. All sushi were excellent. We ate in the small private room downstairs. A bit like some Chinese restaurants. Suggest the fried pumpkin, the crab maki, the dumplings. Honest food and not too pricey. Not the most original menu but plenty of choices.

8_McxO6MEiC_4fek0nF7gQ.text: Really fresh and reasonably-priced sushi. The wasabi isn't made from powder but appears to be the real deal. Plenty of things for non-sushi lovers (or kids) to eat. The decor won't win any prizes but I wouldn't have it any other way. It's homey and the staff are warm and professional.

23D-Qmt4Q4KfUceh53fPMQ.text: My 5 star review in this case definitely has a "for London" caveat. Affordable sushi and other stuff (very extensive menu), a bit off the beaten path, nice staff, hole-in-the-wall, neighborhoody atmosphere.  If you have friends who don't like sushi, assure them they also have "other cooked stuff."Plus, they actually know how to properly season their sushi rice! This is my new restaurant of choice in Notting HIll.

ZxD6PoGIqzHa7J3kzpXbIA.text: Fresh and inventive sushi here, presented on a very beautiful way. It can get very busy so finding a table might be a challenge and service felt a bit slow. The quality of food made us trying to come back but had no chance on a Fri night without reservation.

lNPh6GCzyUqfi8yehSoj7A.text: Cheap eats doesn't always work out to be a good meal but in this case, it was. Lunch specials start at only £9 for a bento and the portion is enough for a substantial meal. The menu is large - choose from sushi, rolls, tempura, soba, tonkatsu, teriyaki, salmon, donburi, etc. I was happy with my bento's quality - tasty miso soup, salad with dressing, lots of rice, pickles and your choice of main (one or two). The star was actually the fried tofu which was soft on the inside, a slight crisp shell soaked in soy dashi and topped with wakame. I left full and happy!On the down side, staff need to work on their customer service. Definitely not the traditional customer-first attitude most Japanese restaurants provide. I also had to ask for more water as no one checked on me mid-meal. Decor is minimal and you literally walk through the crowded kitchen to get to the seating area. It's not somewhere I would take a date but if you want cheap and cheerful, this is your place.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat Tokyo - London, United Kingdom. 9 Tonkatsu bento

b2dJiEuuZWcud0BTzVXcWw.text: I'm rather late to the party. Having walked past Eat Tokyo countless time believing it was little more than a takeaway counter, I finally ventured in and was amazed by the fairly spacious restaurant in the back. Nothing fancy and not exactly minimalist Japanese. The menu covers everything from shushi and tempura to bento boxes and is almost a bit overwhelming. Perhaps lucky then that most cooked food was unavailable due to a major repairs to the gas mains outside. We ended up with a random selection of raw and fried foods - all delicious.Staff were extremely helpful and friendly, no wonder this is such a favourite with locals.

_0DEhH7G9yo8xlQolFm1KQ.text: Arrived for our 7:30 reservation this evening. Owner/host claimed we didn't have a reservation. Asked him if the outgoing call on my iPhone from the previous evening was Eat Tokyo's phone number. Surprise, surprise - it was. So it was all very Seinfeld. They know how to take a reservation, but don't know how to keep a reservation. No offer to seat us later that evening. That's poor form. Eat Tokyo, you're through, next.

h94aQTfSCO4B1CGlt6h5cg.text: Appalling. You must avoid this place. I walked in Saturday early night without reservations. I got seat luckily. However I was forced to change seat as much of twice repeatedly without any apologies from staffs. I was upset and went out. I will never be back here.I wish no one will experience similar things to mine.

5-TkazxdREmA_DHs-LFDtg.text: On my quest to find the best onigiri in London, I asked them if they offered them and they said no :( but then they gave me a cellophane-wrapped piece of seaweed and gave me instructions on how to make the onigiri at home with the side dish of rice that I had ordered. SO so nice!It doesn't look like much from the outside but this place is so authentic! They have the best sushi in all of London, with an extensive menu and great service too.

4t9Etc6Bw1OamwCNy0Iowg.text: Authentic food, good portion and good price. I loved everything and ended up having the entire table of food by myself. Would definitely go again and try other dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat Tokyo - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Eat Tokyo - London, United Kingdom

er-FozEkXk3c7jc94BfaKg.text: The sushi here was incredible! Great service. Prepared quickly. Love the location. Has won several awards. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat Tokyo - London, United Kingdom

ogzMEhXvnSMXqnWMe_Ewgg.text: Two words: Bento Box. Get any configuration you desire (chicken/beef teriyaki, salmon, sashimi and on an on) and I think you will fare fine.  I saw actual Japanese people dining here and although that's not the best indicator of authentic, it at least gives me some level of confidence.  The food was good and so was the service.

V1fjMu7WWkpbK_eGOgI9Qw.text: Some of the best sushi outside of Japan I have ever had. Service was quick, & food was excellent!!! The staff was very friendly, and squeezed us in without a reservation on a Friday night.

qV0fODuLUOeujKjhETMFEQ.text: Absolute little gem of a sushi place. Hidden off the maim road in nottinghill, a two.minute walk from the station.When you walk in you would be forgiven for thinking this is a small takaway shop but the tavles are through the back. We were.led.by a friendly waitress in colourful kimino. You csn see the sushi checs busy st work in the open kitchen area. Whilst this place is a little cramped it really is worth it.The fish tastes extremely fresh and the salmon and tuna sashimi were melt in the mouth. I found the tempura vegetables a little flavourless and the dipping sauce for it didn't have much taste however this is my only complaint. The fried seafood dumplings were delectable and a bargain at £3 for 4. I am a bit of a spicy tuna maki aficionado and the standard here is good. The plum wine was sweet and delicious too! With lots of sushi restaurants vying for business I really feel that this place is a cht above the rest.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat Tokyo - London, United Kingdom

CkILM0O7AhSBaJyKD929LQ.text: Very delicious authentic Japanese food!As a Japanese, it had been difficult to get satisfied with Japanese food in London until I visited there! I will definitely visit there again sometime especially when I get homesick..hahaThe taste is quite same as food in Japan! They use some typical Japanese ingredients like SHISO(Japanese herb)! Each plate, Donburi and Jyu is very volumy so all of us got full after we ate half of them. The price is good! Even dinner it costs around £16 per person! But I wish there were more smaller size with a bit cheeper options!The waitors and waitresses were so cheerful and helpful so we had a very pleasant evening! I felt they enjoy communicating with customers!

photos.caption: Photo of Eat Tokyo - London, United Kingdom. I ordered a kaisendon and korokke! Very yummy!
Photo of Eat Tokyo - London, United Kingdom. Certificated from Japanese organisation!
Photo of Eat Tokyo - London, United Kingdom. The restaurant has small entrance but the inside was quite big!

GCg9W6r3uw39rNsx0zUMaA.text: I am a very famous actor from the USA and I called for a reservation. I asked not to be bothered by photographers and paparazzi. They totally took care of me and let me enjoy my meal.  Great place great food

zilHKjV1H4z-FBkRbEFcAg.text: 5 stars only because of this shitty rating scale. It's not perfect but I really liked the place. Food; very tasty and fresh, small sushi menu, looks like they are aimed more towards actual traditional Japanese food. Price; For London, outskirts, and it's on a smaller side portions I think it's at two ££.Service; this is large one for me, employees atmosphere is very important to me for a good dining experience. Everyone was smiling, working well together. Multiple servers that kept everything under control without any mistakes. Verdict; I highly recommend! Make sure you make a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat Tokyo - London, United Kingdom. Exceptional fresh uncooked shrimp.

CsKS9xxRaWx4RDWJW24Uog.text: Top Sushi Restaurant of London at a very good price. The food is really amazing, some flavor are really feeling like you're in japan. The restaurant is managed by Japanese staff, it probably helps.The room at the back is not so comfy but you go there for the food first. Taste is what matters and you won't be disappointed here !

photos.caption: Photo of Eat Tokyo - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Eat Tokyo - London, United Kingdom

qEvao9dL22HtjGKvD8YY6A.text: My go-to Japanese comfort food! Great portions. Authentic and reasonably priced. This place gets pretty hectic to make a reservation or come early. The staff is friendly enough, though sometimes they seem super busy. My faves are the tempura don (awesome sauce), tori-Kage, fatty tuna sashimi, and all the bentos.

photos.caption: Photo of Eat Tokyo - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Eat Tokyo - London, United Kingdom. Fatty tuna

IEiOnbv771qQt4aUgUtQjg.text: Being a resident of the smiling little neighbourhood of NottingHill, i figured I would give this small little joint a try, and I'd say I'm a fan. By fan I mean the following though: I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, though in the grand scheme of things it's an above average joint. Good quality food, good sashimi, decently priced, great selection, attentive staff. I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could, but it's arguably just A-Ok.

27atyifMXbDyLUA73-DJ4Q.text: We waited about 45 minutes to sit on a Sunday at 2:00 pm. It was packed which is always a good sign. The place is tiny. We were super excited to have sushi but a bit disappointed when we left. Everyone else seemed to have ordered much better dishes than our table and a lot of it. Our rolls were quite boring and not very tasty.

Dd9KhfcqxbOygVFi2TSNkg.text: Eat Tokyo in Notting Hill is crazy bunk. You walk in and you look at your sister quizzically, at the same time wondering if she's making a joke by bringing you here, and at the same time sad that she's thinks this is ok.Nigiri sushi was fine, if flavourless, but the rolls, oh Christ, thank god I'd asked for extra napkins because that first and only bite had to go somewhere other than my stomach.Chicken karaage was very fatty and was not worth the calories, same goes the tempura.The server was sweet but kindness is not love and sadly cannot conquer all.

dfhl-1PzQuoi1nxbZN3jbA.text: I love this place. The only thing holding them back from 5 stars is their atrocious service. Pro: Delicious authentic sushi at a reasonable price point. What more do you want at a sushi place!Classic hole-in-the-wall ambiance.You feel like you're in Japan!Con: The carry-out business interferes pretty massively with the dining experience (e.g., people will be waiting for their food and be all up in your grill depending on your table location.)When it gets busy, it takes forever to order and get your foodBad service in general, but the food is so amazing you just don't carePretty unimaginative selection of sushi rolls (but the ones they do have are great!)

s_TUlkx2rT_z-kTgznP1oQ.text: Don't know what the hype is.Chirashi had subpar quality fish with a piece of tuna that has a very slight color unevenness that was very slightly falling apart (a sign it's not fresh).The sashimi was of much better quality but in a good restaurant they should never serve questionable quality raw fish in another dish that was of a lower profit margin/price. You should just use the parts of fish that is cheaper or just give less. But never use lower quality (I.e. Older less fresh).Most of the menu was typical Westernized sushi/sushi roll items that was not the most inspiring menu I have ever seen in my life. In fact I am rather uninspired.The prices are very reasonable but then it is because the quality is not the best I has seen (average). Service was so-so, in fact the server gave everyone's bills and I gave up waiting for mine after 10-15 minutes despite trying to chase down people. I almost felt like I needed to walk out for them to action. The restaurant is managed by one or two Japanese person but the kitchen is mainly staffed w people of Southeast Asian background (they are competent of course just want to point out not everyone is Japanese as some reviews may lead you to believe).You should strive to eat fresher and better Japanese food if you can. Otherwise this place will do fine if you need a quick fixer upper in this area (close to Nottinghill Gate tube station). I would only come back to this "meh" place if I had to... But not worth going out of my way.
